title: Error crashes interactive lfort
body:
*Original issue*: https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/113

```
$./lfort
Interactive Fortran.
  * Use Ctrl-D to exit.
  * Use Enter to submit.
  * Features:
    - Multi-line editing (use Alt-Enter)
    - History
    - Syntax highlighting

> integer :: a(3)
> a = [1, 2, 3]
LHS Array Type mismatch
> a
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./lfort", line 6, in <module>
    main()
  File "/home/aaronmeurer/Documents/lfortran/lfortran/cli.py", line 97, in main
    main(verbose=verbose)
  File "/home/aaronmeurer/Documents/lfortran/lfortran/prompt.py", line 122, in main
    handle_input(engine, fortran_evaluator, text, verbose)
  File "/home/aaronmeurer/Documents/lfortran/lfortran/prompt.py", line 63, in handle_input
    mod = evaluator.llvm_code_generation(ast_tree)
  File "/home/aaronmeurer/Documents/lfortran/lfortran/codegen/evaluator.py", line 91, in llvm_code_generation
    self.symbol_table_visitor._global_scope))
  File "/home/aaronmeurer/Documents/lfortran/lfortran/codegen/gen.py", line 678, in codegen
    v.codegen(tree)
  File "/home/aaronmeurer/Documents/lfortran/lfortran/codegen/gen.py", line 235, in codegen
    self.visit(tree)
  File "/home/aaronmeurer/Documents/lfortran/lfortran/ast/ast.py", line 1048, in visit
    return node.walkabout(self)
  File "/home/aaronmeurer/Documents/lfortran/lfortran/ast/ast.py", line 189, in walkabout
    return visitor.visit_Function(self)
  File "/home/aaronmeurer/Documents/lfortran/lfortran/codegen/gen.py", line 636, in visit_Function
    self.visit_sequence(node.body)
  File "/home/aaronmeurer/Documents/lfortran/lfortran/ast/ast.py", line 1045, in visit_sequence
    self.visit(node)
  File "/home/aaronmeurer/Documents/lfortran/lfortran/ast/ast.py", line 1048, in visit
    return node.walkabout(self)
  File "/home/aaronmeurer/Documents/lfortran/lfortran/ast/ast.py", line 337, in walkabout
    return visitor.visit_Assignment(self)
  File "/home/aaronmeurer/Documents/lfortran/lfortran/codegen/gen.py", line 344, in visit_Assignment
    raise Exception("Type mismatch in assignment.")
Exception: Type mismatch in assignment.
```

Errors should not crash the interpreter.
